title: Can we use any other liquid instead of water in a specific gravity test? If yes, what is the liquid? - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the reasons why water is used for specific gravity measurement is because of its universal availability. So when you say specific gravity of a certain liquid is ‘x’ I know whether it is heavier or lighter than water since I have used water all my life I have an intuitive feel of the mass of a liter of water. You can use any liquid as a reference since specific gravity is just a ratio and can be defined with any liquid.

Can we use any other liquid instead of water in a specific gravity test? If yes, what is the liquid? In the standard specific gravity test for Portland cement, we use kerosene. Water has unpleasant consequences for cement in that test.
